peripheral.title: SPI
peripheral.help_text:
The Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) bus is a simple communication interface,
allowing the microcontroller to communicate with nearby external devices. The interface is highly
configurable to support many synchronous standard communications protocols.

peripheral.title: SPI
peripheral.help_text:
The Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) bus is a simple communication interface,
allowing the microcontroller to communicate with nearby external devices. The interface is highly
configurable to support many synchronous standard communications protocols. It can work :
• Up to 50 Mbit/s in master and slave modes.
• In half-duplex, fullduplex and simplex modes.

link.index: Serial peripheral interface (SPI1, SPI2, SPI3, SPI4, SPI5, SPI6)– inter- integrated sound interfaces (I2S1, I2S2, I2S3)
